study_title: Wen et al., Immune cell profiling of COVID-19 patients in the recovery stage by single-cell sequencing
study_description: An inflammatory immune signature in the early recovery stage of COVID-19 suggests patients are still vulnerable after hospital discharge.
grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
lab_name: National Center for Liver Cancer, Second Military Medical University
lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China
collection_time_point_reference: Less than N days after first negative COVID-19 test
tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.
data_processing_protocols:
Processing by iReceptor: VDJ-T, VDJ-B, and GEX libraries from a single subject were processed together with Cell Ranger multi pipeline (v.6.0.1) with command:
cellranger vdj --localcores=8 --localmem=64 --id=$SUBJECT --csv=$SUBJECT.csv
Content of csv:
[gene-expression]
reference,/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-gex-GRCh38-2020-A
[vdj]
reference,/imgt/2021-06-01/vdj_IMGT_human/
[libraries]
fastq_id,fastqs,lanes,feature_types,subsample_rate
$SUBJECT,/fastq_files/$SUBJECT/gex,any,Gene Expression,
$SUBJECT,/fastq_files/$SUBJECT/b-cell,any,VDJ-B,
$SUBJECT,/fastq_files/$SUBJECT/t-cell,any,VDJ-T,

For each subject, TR and IG annotations were split into loci (TRA/TRB/IGH/IGK/IGL) with command: head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $SUBJECT-$LOCUS.tsv; egrep '$LOCUS[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $SUBJECT-$LOCUS.tsv
germline_database: IMGT based V(D)J reference built with cellranger (v.6.0.1.) fetch-imgt and mkvdjref, built 2021-06-01

grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
lab_name: National Center for Liver Cancer, Second Military Medical University
lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China
collection_time_point_reference: More than N days after first negative COVID-19 test
tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.
data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: To create AIRR Clone files, script 10x-vdj2clone.py was run on the split TRB or IGH rearrangements
germline_database: IMGT based V(D)J reference built with cellranger (v.6.0.1.) fetch-imgt and mkvdjref, built 2021-06-01

reference,/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-gex-GRCh38-2020-A

[libraries]
fastq_id,fastqs,lanes,feature_types,subsample_rate
